channel.title: Pedro Ribeiro — Systems Engineering Vault
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Pedro Ribeiro — Systems Engineering Vault

item.title: index
item.description: 🏯 Enter the Dojo Welcome to my coding vault — a living collection of experiments in C, systems programming, threading, allocators, and asymmetric projects.

item.title: 01_fd_dup_chain_bomb
item.description: 🔥💾 INITIATING PROJECT 01_fd_dup_chain_bomb/ Let’s weaponize dup() — turn it into a system-filling, table-clogging, FD-exhausting monster.

item.title: 02_fd_leak_visualizer
item.description: 🔥 Let’s roll out your next vault weapon: 🧠 02_fd_leak_visualizer 💣 FD Leak Visualizer See what happens when FDs are opened without being closed.

item.title: 03_read_closed_fd_trap
item.description: 💥 LET’S TRIGGER SOME KERNEL TEARS 🧠 03_read_closed_fd_trap 💣 read() From a Closed FD What happens if you try to read from an FD you already closed? This vault entry shows how the kernel responds — and how you can catch and analyze it.

item.title: 04_fd_mirror_fanout
item.description: 💥🔥 MIRROR MODE ENGAGED 🧠 04_fd_mirror_fanout 🔁 FD Mirror Fanout What happens when you dup() the same FD over and over? Do they share the same offset? Do they interfere? Let’s mirror one FD into a fan of duplicates and test the behavior.

item.title: 05_fd_exhaustion_test
item.description: 💣💀 SYSTEM MELTDOWN SIMULATOR COMING RIGHT UP 🧠 05_fd_exhaustion_test 🔥 FD Exhaustion Test Let’s see what happens when you open as many file descriptors as your system allows.

item.title: 06_malloc_after_fork_glitch
item.description: 💥 LET’S UNLEASH A CLASSIC UNIX TRAP 🧠 06_malloc_after_fork_glitch 💣 “What happens when a multithreaded process forks… then uses malloc() in the child?” ✅ Short answer: 🧨 Undefined behavior.

item.title: 08_malloc_tls_isolation_test
item.description: 🔥 Roger that. 180-IQ strategic advisor fully deployed.
